definition: Unique global identifier assigned to the location where the event occurred.
Global unique identifier assigned to an Event (something that occurs at a place and time, such as a survey or measurement).
The verbatim event ID from the originating source dataset assigned by the program.
NAdefinition: Event ID was not included or reported in the source dataset.

definition: The calendar date of the event from the source data.
NAdefinition: Source data from AREMP do not contain month or day, so no there is no eventDate for those entries.

definition: The four-digit year in which the event occurred.
The name of, reference to, or description of the stream survey method or protocol used during an Event.
NAdefinition: Sampling Protocol was not included or reported in the source dataset.
examples: UV light trap, "mist net", "bottom trawl", "ad hoc observation", "point count", "Penguins from space: faecal stains reveal the location of emperor penguin colonies, http://dx.doi.org/10.1111/j.1466-8238.2009.00467.x", "Takats et al. 2001. Guidelines for Nocturnal Owl Monitoring in North America. Beaverhill Bird Observatory and Bird Studies Canada, Edmonton, Alberta. 32 pp.", "http://www.bsc-eoc.org/download/Owl.pdf"

definition: The description of flow for the reach (flow, partial flow or dry).
NAdefinition: Description of the flow was not included or reported in the source dataset.

definition: Beaver impact the flow of the reach.
NAdefinition: Beaver impacts were not reported in the source data.
